intro: Gutierrezia copiapina, commonly known as the Copiapó goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and small, linear leaves adapted to conserve water in its harsh environment. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and desert landscapes. Gutierrezia copiapina plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
